name: Bright Eyes Restorative Colloidal Silver Depuffing & Brightening Eye Gels
about: What it is:A pair of eye masks that de-puffs and brightens the look of eyes while diminishing the appearance of fine lines..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dark Circles, Fine Lines and Wrinkles, and Puffiness.Formulation:Lightweight Mask.Highlighted Ingredients:.Ingredient Callouts:This product is  cruelty-free, and gluten-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:These masks are formulated with pure colloidal silver which helps nurture skin to give the look of up to 10 hours of rest. The illuminating pearl helps eyes appear brighter while natural collagen helps firm and tighten the look of skin. These masks may also be used on nose-to-mouth area..Clinical Results:In a consumer perception survey after using Bright Eyes:
ingredients: -Illuminating Pearl: Helps eyes appear brighter and more rested..-Natural Collagen: Helps firm and tighten skinu2019s appearance..-Colloidal Silver: Helps diminish the appearance of puffiness...WATER/AQUA/EAU, GLYCERIN, COLLOIDAL SILVER, PROPYLENE GLYCOL, BETAINE, HAMAMELIS VIRGINIANA (WITCH HAZEL) EXTRACT, CHONDRUS CRISPUS POWDER, MICA, ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF JUICE, HYDROLYZED COLLAGEN, SODIUM HYALURONATE, GLUCOMANNAN, ALGIN, NIACINAMIDE, PEARL POWDER, FRAGRANCE/PARFUM, XANTHAN GUM, CHLORPHENESIN, PHENOXYETHANOL, POTASSIUM CHLORIDE, CITRIC ACID, POTASSIUM CITRATE
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply to clean, dry skin. .-May be used under the eyes and on nose-to-mouth lines. .-Allow key ingredients to soak into application area for at least 10 minutes, may be worn longer. .-Discard patches after each use.

reviews.review_title: Possibly a decent formula, terrible execution
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First, the serum has the consistency of water so the majority of it is left inside the foil pouch when you remove the tray that holds the eye patches.  I dabbed some of the serum under my eyes and poured the rest onto the patches.  When I put the patches on the serum dripped down my face, along with the patches themselves.  Within about 10 seconds the patches were half way down my face.  I kept sliding them back up until finally after a few minutes they decided to sort of stay put.  I felt some kind of sensation from the formula, almost a slight stinging sensation.  Maybe that means its doing something?  I'm not sure, but I will absolutely never use these again because the experience was just so bad.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just started using these eye masks, and I noticed a difference the first time I used them.  It looks like someone photoshopped my eyes- that's how amazingly these worked for me.  I'm a contact tracer, and needless to say I've been busy lately.  Today was the first day off I've had in several weeks.  I'd actually purchased these weeks ago, but haven't found the time to use them- probably during a time when I needed them the most. My eyes have been very puffy, dry, and all-around dull.  The skin around my eyes looked thin and frail.  But these eye masks really brought my eyes back to life- I'm truly astounded.  I should note, I'm relatively new to using eye masks- I've  previously only tried 2 other brands.  I (personally) found these to be far superior to the other ones I've tried- and they didn't irritate the sensitive skin around my eyes.  After using them once, there were no more lines, and the puffiness was gone.  I kept looking in the mirror because I couldn't believe the results were real.  I'm so happy with the outcome, and wholeheartedly recommend this product for others with the same skincare concerns.

reviews.review_text: I have very puffy eyes, partially due to genetics and partially due to the stress of an ongoing health condition. Without exaggeration, I can honestly say that Iu2019ve tried most eye patch masks on the market. Most are just ok, and these are no exception. They look awfully pretty, I loved the silver pearlescent look, and they were nice and cool and relaxing while on. I found that they did slip a little, as most do. I left them on for about two hours, until they turned completely shriveled and dry. I used 4 packets over the course of a holiday week, and while I enjoyed having them on and they didnu2019t cause any unpleasant side effects, they really arenu2019t anything special. They didnu2019t really de-puff at all, and they certainly didnu2019t brighten my eye area. I think itu2019s worth noting that every single one of the first (and at this moment,only) 10 reviews on here are absolutely fake, made by the company. Every reviewer has only ever reviewed BeautyBio products, all just signed up, and not a single one has reviewed anything else. I find that the company decided to do that so off-putting. There are so many new companies, or well established brands that are just launching at Sephora, that do not use fake reviews to bolster their credibility, and I think it speaks volumes about the integrity of the brand as a whole. That being said, if these knocked my socks off I would be willing to look the other way about this tacky tactic, but these are really just nothing to write home about. The Peter Thomas Roth ones are way better, at a much better value
